etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French alutel, via Spanish from Arabic al-'uṯāl ‘the sublimation vessel’

definitions: a pear-shaped earthenware or glass pot, open at both ends to enable a series to be fitted one above another, formerly used in sublimation and other chemical processes.
shortDefinitions: pear-shaped earthenware or glass pot, open at both ends to enable series to be fitted one above another
